children.text: The bottom plate of the upper wall is overhanging the edge of the floor frame.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 4.08 states that
‘An overhang of up to 10mm is permissible’.
This overhanging bottom plate will need to be supported so it complies with this tolerance, such as a timber cleat/trimmer, appropriately fixed to the face of the floor joists/beam.
